definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: The messenger bent and scratched at his knee where the strapping chafed.
sentences.chinese: 送信人彎下腰來，撓着膝部被綁腿磨紅的地方。

sentences.english: He was dressed in woolen leggings.
This is the perfect footwear with jeans or leggings on cold days.
sentences.chinese: 這是與牛仔褲或在寒冷的日子綁腿完美的鞋。

sentences.english: Belt loops and gaiter with gripper elastic.
sentences.chinese: 帶循環和綁腿抓手彈性。

sentences.english: Extended gaiter for added leg protection from elements and ski edges.
sentences.chinese: 添加元素和滑雪邊緣的腿保護擴展綁腿。

sentences.english: The solider are all assembled with gaiters.
Suspension gaiters with hook and loop boot hook.
sentences.chinese: 暫停與鉤環啓動鉤綁腿。

sentences.english: Ankle length leggings may only be worn with dresses or skirts that are at or below the knee.
sentences.chinese: 腳踝的長度綁腿只可穿的衣服或裙子，或在膝蓋以下。

sentences.english: Changes Clio outside the gaiters help.
sentences.chinese: 克里歐外綁腿變化的幫助。

definition: fitting one's feet (of shoes or socks)
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
